definition: to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Fishastic ceremony inside design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢境的揭幕式，設計和實行都特殊好。

sentences.english: Fould likeastic ceremony in the design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢境的揭幕式，設計和實行都特別好。

sentences.english: Welcome to the opening ceremony of the photo exhibition "Expo 2010 Shanghai, China".
sentences.chinese: 接待列位出席“上海世博會圖片展”揭幕式勾當。

sentences.english: Fould likeastic ceremony at design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢境的揭幕式，設計和實行都十分好。

sentences.english: Fantastic ceremony both in design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢幻的揭幕式，設計和執行都非常好。

sentences.english: The opening night concert featured unaccompanied cello only.
sentences.chinese: 揭幕式當晚的音樂會重要以大提琴獨奏爲主。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony that day, I sat beside watch TV.
sentences.chinese: 揭幕典禮那天，我在電視機旁看揭幕式。

definition: to cut the ribbon (at a launching or opening ceremony)
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to make a speech/to make some remarks
